SEARCH
Package utility

Class AsciiArt

java.lang.Object
utility.AsciiArt
public class AsciiArt extends Object
AsciiArt holds ASCII art that will be printed to the console at the start of the game and at every turn. This class includes ASCII art for cards, game messages, and special game modes like BlackJack.

  • Field Details

    • colorToCard

      public static Map<String,List<String>> colorToCard
      Stores card templates for each color. Each color has a list of 7 strings that represent the ASCII art for each line of the card. These templates are used to build the visual representation of cards in the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • AsciiArt

      public AsciiArt()

  • Method Details

    • getCardTemplate

      public static String getCardTemplate(String color)
      Get the ASCII art template for a specific card color.
      Parameters:
      color - The color of the card
      Returns:
      String containing the ASCII art template

    • getCardPrinted

      public static String getCardPrinted(List<Card> partOfList)
      Prints a horizontal line of Cards. If a card is null, a blank space will be printed instead.
      Parameters:
      partOfList - A sublist of Cards to be printed in one row.
      Returns:
      A formatted string representing the row of Cards.

    • printLine

      public static String printLine(List<Card> listOfCard)
      This handles the card printing for ParadeLine and for the Player's hand.
      Parameters:
      listOfCard - Contains the amount of Cards needed to be printed.
      Returns:
      String containing the printed cards.

    • formatCardLine

      public static String formatCardLine(int lineNo, int value, String color)
      Formats a specific line of a card's ASCII art representation. This function handles the formatting of individual lines of a card's display, applying the card's value to the appropriate lines (1 and 5) and returning the formatted line with any trailing whitespace removed. Ultimately, this function's high-level function is to format the String representation of the line of cards properly for printLine to print the cards out correctly.
      Parameters:
      lineNo - The line number (0-6) of the card's ASCII art to format
      value - The numeric value of the card to be displayed
      color - The color of the card (e.g., "red", "blue")
      Returns:
      A formatted string representing the specified line of the card

    • printEmptyCardCollection

      public static String printEmptyCardCollection()

      Returns:
      A string representation of an empty collection zone.

      public static String declarePlayerRound(String playerName, String turn)
